description: what you'll be doing We make little drinks that do big things, and we’re always looking for ways to do things better. That means change – the good kind – and we need someone who can help us make it happen. You’ll be hands‑on in turning plans into reality, keeping things moving, and helping make sure our change projects land well across the business. A good understanding of project or change management fundamentals (formal qualifications like Prince2 or MoP are a bonus, not a must). Strong organisation and communication skills – you’re comfortable juggling tasks and working with lots of different stakeholders. A problem‑solving mindset and a willingness to roll up your sleeves when things get tricky. A collaborative approach and a genuine interest in learning, improving and trying new ways of doing things. you'll get The chance to work on meaningful projects that help shape how our business grows and changes. Exposure to a wide range of teams and stakeholders across innocent. A supportive environment where you’ll learn from experienced change and transformation professionals. Opportunities to build your skills in project, portfolio and change management over time. We want innocent to be a great place to work , so we do lots of stuff to make people feel at home and try to make sure everyone’s career is shaping up the way they want it to. There are plenty of opportunities to have a go at something new or take things further. In exchange for helping us do business in the right way, you’ll get a solid rewards package that includes a salary (phew), private healthcare, a target-based bonus, and a bunch of other nice things like a day off on your birthday. And yes, you get free smoothies. We also know that not all our drinkers come from the same background, or think the same – so why should we? At innocent, we want to be a great place to work where a diverse bunch of people from all backgrounds can turn up and thrive. When we hire, we want all the juice, bits, and pulp that make you who you are. Even if you don’t think you can tick all the boxes, if the job sounds right for you, come and throw your hat in the ring. Probably best to get your skates on though, as we might close this early if we get loads of applications.

title: Office Administration Assistant Manager
Job Title: 台灣徵才 - Office Administration Assistant Manager (行政副理)
Job Responsibilities:: Manage Administration Functions (35%) · Manage full spectrum of office administration functions to ensure smooth daily office operations (ensure administrative operations and procedures are organized, correspondences are controlled, filing systems are designed, supply requisitions are reviewed and managed, and reception desk and administration function are properly assigned and monitored · Manage office administration related contracts, leases, and price negotiations with SCM and manage relationships with vendors, service providers, and landlord, ensuring that all invoices are accurate and paid on time. · Manage e-coupon production execution and data base maintenance with accuracy & efficiency · Prepare annual budget for the office expenses, plan the expenditures, analyze variances, and carry out necessary corrections that may arise · Partner with HR and management team to develop and implement office policies, procedures, and standards to guide the operation of the office · Maintain a safe, secure, and pleasant work environment Support Management Team and RSC Staff (30%) · Point person for JRGTW to coordinate schedules, appointments, and bookings meetings (with JRG, Yum, Taiwan Management meeting, external Associations…etc.) · Manage executives' schedules, calendars, and appointments (CEO, FD and HRD) · Provide secretarial support to JRG management team, including arrange meeting/travel logistics, minutes taking, creating PowerPoint slides…etc. · Provide general support to RSC staff and visitors People Management and Development (20%) · Recruit, train, coach and develop ADM staff · Allocate tasks and assignments to ADM staff and monitor their performance; ensure that results are measured against standards, while making necessary changes along the way · Remain updated on technical and professional knowledge by attending educational workshops, joining professional associations, building networks with fellow professionals Event Management (15%) · Organize/support company events and staff activities, e.g., RSC birthday party, JRG townhall, …etc. · Other ad-hoc tasks as assigned
Requirements:: An energetic professional who doesn't mind wearing multiple hats. Experienced in handling a wide range of administrative duties and executives support-related tasks and able to work independently with little or no supervision. Well organized, flexible, and enjoys the administrative challenges of supporting an office of diverse people. 1. Minimum education requirement · Degree holder in business admin or related disciplines 2. Relevant experience and minimum years required · 8-10 years of proven office management, administrative, or assistant experience · 3-5 years office management experience preferred 3. Knowledge, skills, and competence requirements · Good command of spoken and written English and Mandarin · Good digital/technology software skills and good at MS Office Applications · Logical & positive thinking, proactive, with professional attitude, excellent communication and interpersonal skills · Sound knowledge and strong in planning, office administration management and people management · Attention to detail and problem-solving skills; good at time management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work

title: Learning and Development Executive
Job Title: 台灣徵才- 教育訓練執行專員 Learning and Development Executive
Job Responsibilities:: 【Learning & Development】- 70% - Coordinate and deliver learning programs aligned with business needs (e.g., Leadership Workshops, Talent Wednesday, Capability College). - Prepare and maintain learning materials, including slides, manuals, and e-learning content, ensuring quality and consistency. - Manage training logistics, vendor communication, and participant coordination to ensure a seamless learner experience. - Track attendance, collect feedback, and conduct program effectiveness review for continuous improvement. - Prepare and consolidate monthly, quarterly, and annual training reports, including completion rates, engagement data, budget utilization, and key insights for management review. - Support annual learning budget planning and expense tracking. - Facilitate new joiner onboarding and company orientation to ensure smooth cultural integration. - Maintain accurate and updated training data and records in the system. 【People & Culture Projects】-30% - Participate in assigned HR development or engagement projects (e.g., Onboarding Revamp, Talent Review, MBO Development, Engagement Survey follow-up). - Collaborate with PNC and cross-functional teams to implement and communicate project deliverables. - Conduct data collection, analysis, and documentation to support project progress and improvement. - Identify and recommend process enhancement opportunities related to learning and employee experience.
Requirements:: 1.  Education: • Bachelor’s degree or above (preferably in HR, Psychology, Business, or related fields). 2.  Experience: • Minimum 3 years in Learning & Development or HR-related roles, preferably in dynamic or multi-brand organizations. 3.  Skills and Competencies: • Strong coordination and project management skills. • Excellent interpersonal and communication abilities. • Analytical mindset with attention to detail and follow-through. • Proficient in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint) and familiar with digital learning tools (e.g., Canva, Gamma, Learning Hub). • Fluent in both English and Chinese (spoken and written). 4.  Personal Attributes: • Growth mindset and self-driven learner. • Accountable, organized, and adaptable to change. • Collaborative team player passionate about people development and culture building.

title: Occupational Health Nurse Team Lead
Job Title: 台灣徵才-職業健康護理師主管 Occupational Health Nurse Team Lead
Job Responsibilities:: 【主要工作職責】 員工健康管理與服務 規劃與執行年度員工健康檢查及後續健康管理作業 追蹤與管理健康檢查異常個案，提供個別健康諮詢與關懷 推動健康促進活動及職場健康教育（如運動、營養） 提供員工日常健康諮詢、一般傷病處置與急救應變 關懷特殊健康對象（如：中高風險個案、母性、重大疾病或職災復工） 推動員工健康管理系統之建置和維護 法規與專案推動 規劃並執行四大健康保護計畫： ▪ 人因工程計畫 ▪ 過勞預防計畫 ▪ 不法侵害防治計畫 ▪ 母性健康保護計畫 協助雇主進行職業病預防、工作場所訪視與改善建議 依照《勞工健康保護規則》要求規劃及執行臨場健康服務 持續追蹤職業健康與安全相關法規（如職業安全衛生法、食品安全衛生法等），轉化為實務行動與訓練教材 提供組織內部法規遵循上的專業建議 團隊管理與品質監督 領導並管理職護團隊，進行人員工作分配、績效管理與能力培育 招募與培訓新進護理人員，提升團隊整體專業水平 建立並優化標準作業流程，確保服務品質與法規符合性 主導專案規劃與執行，進行服務數據分析與成效評估，提出優化建議
Requirements:: 【條件要求】 持有有效護理師執照及勞工健康服務護理人員合格證書 熟悉《職業安全衛生法》及《勞工健康保護規則》等相關法規 具3年以上勞工健康服務相關護理人員經驗 熟練使用 Microsoft Office（Word / PowerPoint）等電腦文書處理能力 個性主動積極、細心負責，具良好溝通協調與抗壓能力 能接受不定期臨場訪視與公出安排 【加分條件（非必須）】 具團隊管理經驗尤佳 曾任職於餐飲業或分散型多據點產業 有建置和維護健康管理系統之經驗

title: Billing Specialist
description: About Xerox Holdings Corporation At Xerox, we make work, work! For more than 100 years, Xerox has continually redefined the workplace experience. From the office to industrial environments, our differentiated business and technology offerings and financial services are essential workplace technology solutions that drive success for our clients and within our culture. Learn more at www.xerox.com and explore our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging. Job Overview: The Billing Specialist is responsible for ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of customer billing processes. This role involves correcting invoices, establishing billing media and frequencies, and supporting operational excellence through data analysis and process improvement. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, a deep understanding of billing systems, and the ability to translate business requirements into functional solutions. Primary Responsibilities: Correct and validate invoices, ensuring accuracy and compliance with billing standards. Establish and maintain billing media and frequency schedules. Deliver accurate and timely operational reporting to management. Analyze data trends to identify process improvement opportunities and support operational efficiency. Participate in root cause analysis for operational deficiencies and recommend corrective actions. Translate business requirements into functional specifications and manage change requests. Assist in identifying automation opportunities and support integration into business processes. Maintain detailed knowledge of systems, organizational structure, and business processes within the assigned area. Design and develop robust data structures and reporting mechanisms to address business needs. Implement technical solutions to improve productivity, billing quality, and reduce unrecognized revenue. Collaborate with cross-functional teams and management to resolve local issues and support strategic initiatives. Support Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and other local or corporate projects. Key Deliverables: Accurate Billing: Timely and error-free invoice corrections and billing setup. Reporting: Delivery of accurate operational and billing reports. Data Analysis: Translate data into actionable insights to improve billing performance. Process Improvements: Identify and implement solutions to enhance billing efficiency and reduce revenue leakage. Technical Documentation: Translate business needs into functional specs and manage change requests. Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to resolve issues and support projects Automation & Innovation: Leverage tools and technology to streamline reporting and billing processes. Skills / Competencies In-depth knowledge and experience in billing operations and systems. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data. Proficiency in developing and maintaining reports and data extracts. Experience in process improvement and implementing technical solutions. Ability to work independently and act as a resource for less experienced colleagues. Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively across teams and management levels. Familiarity with strategic system architecture standards and SOX compliance is a plus. Thinks ahead and anticipates actions Self-motivated to enhance and simplify programs, processes, and experiences Take actions based on observed needs without waiting for direction Moves with speed and urgency to actively address the needs of the business. Innovates to do things differently, more simply and effectively Pivots quickly to address unanticipated obstacles Accepts responsibility for decisions and actions Acknowledges and learns from experience Inclusive of others to reach the best solution Shares information and success with others Expands understanding by seeking other's perspectives Customer-focused Moves decisively to solve customer and business challenges Acts with passion and conviction in interactions with customers, partners, and colleagues Education: Bachelor's Degree in any relevant course. Experience: Prior experience in customer service and SAP is an advantage. #LI-RL1 #LI-ONSITE

Their oversight is essential for maintaining alignment, driving change management, and managing dependencies between projects. description: About Xerox Holdings Corporation At Xerox, we make work, work! For more than 100 years, Xerox has continually redefined the workplace experience. Lexmark (A Subsidiary of Xerox Corporation) is in search of a seasoned network operations engineer with a passion for operating, executing, and enhancing standard processes for maintaining an enterprise network. The selected candidate will collaborate with multiple teams to ensure the implementation of IT operations, security, and network policies. The role involves working with architecture and business teams to ensure the availability of the enterprise network. The engineer will also be responsible for monitoring tool efficiency, setting guidelines, and eliminating barriers to achieve desired outcomes. Additionally, they will liaise with other IT operation teams to resolve any network-related issues. The ideal candidate must possess robust communication skills and the ability to manage competing priorities effectively. WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING: Remote Administration and troubleshooting of switches, routers, firewalls, and cloud networks. Configuration and management of multiple network security systems to include next gen firewalls, unified threat management services, and Secure Access Service Edge (SASE). Deployment of public cloud network services including virtual networks, load balancers, web application firewalls, and virtual gateways. Execution of standard network delivery processes such as VLAN creation, route advertisements, firewall policy configurations, DNS record changes, IPAM network creation, network performance reports, network infrastructure hardening, software/hardware licensing, and virtual network peering. Coordination of high-impact infrastructure changes and outages during on and off-hours. Collaboration with architecture teams providing design feedback, process improvement opportunities, and potential solution enhancements. Act as the escalation contact for the network helpdesk and incident managers. Communicate regularly with management and architecture teams on operational metrics. Light travel will be required to meet with international teams. Hands on support for the deployment of new infrastructure and maintenance of existing infrastructure at the company headquarters location. Be an advocate and change leader for network-security initiatives and operational processes with a goal of improving the overall culture. MUST-HAVE QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, EXPERIENCE Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering or related field with 3-5 years of networking and security experience. Advanced knowledge of LAN, WAN, VLAN, Public Cloud, Wireless, and VoIP networking technologies. Advance knowledge of routing protocols to include Border Gateway Protocol (BGP), Open Shortest Path First (OSPF), and Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol (EIGRP). Advanced knowledge of network security concepts, including web filters, NIDPS, DLP, SSL-DPI, firewalls, etc. Advanced knowledge of network services, including DNS, DHCP, IPAM, SNMP, IPSec, NetFlow. Knowledge of Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) and Network Access Control (NAC) technologies. Knowledge of scripting, automation, and DevOps functions including Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) and Configuration-as-Code (CaC). Experience working with Fortinet, Cisco, InfoBlox, Microsoft Azure, and Amazon Web Services (AWS) technologies. Experience with client facing Network Operations Center (NOC) support. Advanced troubleshooting and diagnostic skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience with ITSM, ITIL, NIST, CIS, and ISO 27001 frameworks. Proven ability to lead and manage multiple priorities with proven organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks with changing priorities. Experience with working with onshore and offshore global teams. Strong ability in multiple technologies, analytical techniques, and leadership skills. In-depth knowledge of Operational Processes (Event, Incident, Change, Problem). Preferred Certifications: Microsoft Azure Certifications (AZ-900, AZ-700, AZ-500, AZ-204) CompTIA + Certifications (Network+, Security+) Cisco Certifications (CCNA, CCNP) EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience). YEARS OF EXPERIENCE IN THIS FIELD 3 to 7 years of experience as a Network Engineer in a global company.

description: About Xerox Holdings Corporation At Xerox, we make work, work! For more than 100 years, Xerox has continually redefined the workplace experience. From the office to industrial environments, our differentiated business and technology offerings and financial services are essential workplace technology solutions that drive success for our clients and within our culture. Learn more at www.xerox.com and explore our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging. Job Overview: The Leasing Specialist is responsible for the end-to-end administration and operational execution of leasing and non-leasing transactions across the EMEA region. The role ensures accurate deal validation, documentation, funder engagement, and timely funding in alignment with internal policies, funder requirements, and customer authorizations. This position supports Sales and Finance by managing lease documentation, deal structuring reviews, payment processing, settlements, commissions, and end-of-lease activities, while maintaining data accuracy across Smartsheet and related systems. The Leasing Specialist acts as a key liaison between Sales, Funders, Finance, and Operations to resolve queries, uphold compliance standards, and deliver a high-quality customer experience throughout the lease lifecycle. Primary Responsibilities: Validate new leasing and non-leasing deals by reviewing and forwarding deal paperwork, lease documents, summary sheets, and approvals to funders to ensure accuracy and readiness for processing. Propose lease deals to funders to obtain credit approval and confirmation to proceed. Propose and manage XBS Cash, non-lease, and third-party funder deals in line with internal and funder requirements. Update and maintain Smartsheet with confirmation of validated deals, queries raised, commission values, credit notes, payments received, paid dates, and agreement numbers. Liaise closely with Sales, Finance, Funders, and Operations to support deal progression, resolve issues, and ensure timely funding and payment receipt. Assist Sales with completing lease documentation for customer signature and ensure documentation completeness and compliance. Send lease documents to customers via DocuSign and other e-signature platforms upon Sales request. Arrange re-signing of lease and related documents due to errors, incorrect information, or incorrect signatories. Review deal structures against customer profiles, RRP, and equipment supplied to confirm alignment with funder and policy requirements. Manage document fee and annual charge waiver requests with funders at Sales or customer request. Calculate commission due on all deals and update records accordingly within Smartsheet and related systems. Key Deliverables: Accurate and timely validation, processing, and funding of lease and non-lease deals. Maintained accuracy and integrity of Smartsheet and leasing documentation. Timely resolution of queries to support on-time payment and customer satisfaction. Effective collaboration with Sales, Finance, Funders, and Operations teams. Compliance with internal controls, audit requirements, and funder agreements. Experience: 1-3 years in order entry or customer service. #LI-RL1 #LI-Onsite

Job Overview: The Order Management Specialist is responsible for accurately entering and processing customer orders, ensuring data accuracy and supporting a smooth order-to-cash process. This role works closely with Sales, Logistics, Customer Service, and in-country teams to meet daily, weekly, and monthly targets for order management activities. Primary Responsibilities: Manage designated workflow effectively to achieve SLA and targets. Input and process orders and returns with 100% accuracy. Review and validate orders for completeness, pricing accuracy, and required documentation. Maintain and update customer details, order notes, billing/shipping information; generate basic reports as needed. Serve as a primary point of contact for order-related inquiries. Ensure compliance with work instructions and corporate guidelines encompassing ethical and financial rules. Support implementation and maintenance of robotic process automation. Key Deliverables: Accurate and timely order processing. Compliance with audit and documentation standards. Achievement of SLA and order management targets. Skills / Competencies: Strong attention to detail and quality orientation. Good communication and multitasking skills. Familiarity with SAP or other CRM/ERP systems. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Adaptable to a changing environment and flexible regarding working patterns. Ensure resource requirements are identified and communicated to enable broader resourcing plans and deal prioritisation., prioritises bid and project management resources. Experience in any of the following areas an advantage: service delivery management, sales / sales management, commercial management. Experience of bid management in other companies an advantage. Proven ability to develop relationships at all levels in an organization Proven ability to resolve problems and break through constraints encountered when leading complex, high risk, high profile pursuits. Strong business acumen Effective under pressure, able to lead and coach others in pressure situations Experience of the selling cycle of services value propositions at C-level Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively, and lead, in a matrix management Environment University degree. Relevant professional qualifications (e.g. PMI, Lean Six Sigma) an advantage #LI-CL1 #LI-HYRBID

JOB PURPOSE/MISSION/SUMMARY: The Transition Coordinator plays a pivotal role in supporting the Transition Project Manager to deliver successful deployment projects across global locations. This position requires strong customer-facing and communication skills to ensure seamless collaboration with internal teams, stakeholders, and clients. The role is responsible for coordinating all phases of deployment, independently managing tasks, and proactively resolving issues related to orders, shipments, and scheduling. By maintaining accurate tracking and documentation, reviewing project risks, and escalating concerns as needed, the Transition Coordinator helps drive efficient installations and continuous process improvement. KEY ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Project Coordination Serve as the central coordinator for multiple assigned project activities and elements. Work closely with internal teams and customers to ensure timelines, accuracy and objectives are met. Participate in meetings to review project feedback and provide status updates. Scheduling & Deployment Create and maintain installation schedules; ensure customer deployments are completed on time. Coordinate delivery of equipment and services with relevant teams. Track order progression, delivery, up to financial install.
